sense.name: a security fastener on, e.g, door, drawer, bicycle
sense.examples: The burglar picked the lock on the door in under a minute. Mary turned the key in the lock to open the trunk. The drawers on the office cabinets have locks for security. Tom puts a lock on his bicycle when he leaves it outside at work. (fastener to post)

sense.name: a strand of hair
sense.examples: She kept a lock of her true love's hair as a remembrance of him. Rapunzel let her long golden locks out the window so the prince could climb up them. Sally's hairstyle is now short curly locks.

sense.name: mechanism that detonates the charge of a gun
sense.examples: The solider released the lock on his gun and fired.

sense.name: mechanism that controls the water level in a section of canal
sense.examples: How many locks do you go through on the Panama Canal? It took about an hour for the water to rise sufficiently for the boat to pass through the lock.

sense.name: safety restraint on an ignition switch
sense.examples: John had to replace the ignition lock on his Camero. The breathalyzer ignition lock was foiled by having the drunkard's 12-year-old son breath into the device.

sense.name: a wrestling hold that twists an opponent
sense.examples: Tom's opponent on the wrestling mat had Tom in a lock. The wrestler escaped the lock that his opponent was attempting on him.

sense.name: controller of airflow through a passageway, airlock
sense.examples: The astronaut passed through two locks before reaching the door of the spacecraft that opened out into space.
